33.20: Job 33:20 so that his life loathes bread, and his appetite the choicest food.
33.21: Job 33:21 His flesh is so wasted away that it cannot be seen, and his bones that were not seen stick out.
33.22: Job 33:22 His soul draws near the pit, and his life to those who bring death.
33.23: Job 33:23 If there be for him an angel, a mediator, one of the thousand, to declare to man what is right for him,
33.24: Job 33:24 and he is merciful to him, and says, 'Deliver him from going down into the pit; I have found a ransom;
33.25: Job 33:25 let his flesh become fresh with youth; let him return to the days of his youthful vigor';
33.26:
Job 33:26 then man prays to God, and he accepts him; he sees his face with a shout of joy, and he restores to
man his righteousness.
33.27: Job 33:27 He sings before men and says: 'I sinned and perverted what was right, and it was not repaid to me.
33.28: Job 33:28 He has redeemed my soul from going down into the pit, and my life shall look upon the light.'
33.29: Job 33:29 "Behold, God does all these things, twice, three times, with a man,
33.30: Job 33:30 to bring back his soul from the pit, that he may be lighted with the light of life.
33.31: Job 33:31 Pay attention, O Job, listen to me; be silent, and I will speak.
33.32: Job 33:32 If you have any words, answer me; speak, for I desire to justify you.
33.33: Job 33:33 If not, listen to me; be silent, and I will teach you wisdom."

34.1: Job 34:1 Then Elihu answered and said:
34.2: Job 34:2 "Hear my words, you wise men, and give ear to me, you who know;
34.3: Job 34:3 for the ear tests words as the palate tastes food.
34.4: Job 34:4 Let us choose what is right; let us know among ourselves what is good.
34.5: Job 34:5 For Job has said, 'I am in the right, and God has taken away my right;
34.6: Job 34:6 in spite of my right I am counted a liar; my wound is incurable, though I am without transgression.'
34.7: Job 34:7 What man is like Job, who drinks up scoffing like water,
34.8: Job 34:8 who travels in company with evildoers and walks with wicked men?
34.9: Job 34:9 For he has said, 'It profits a man nothing that he should take delight in God.'
34.10:
Job 34:10 "Therefore, hear me, you men of understanding: far be it from God that he should do wickedness,
and from the Almighty that he should do wrong.
34.11:
Job 34:11 For according to the work of a man he will repay him, and according to his ways he will make it befall
him.
34.12: Job 34:12 Of a truth, God will not do wickedly, and the Almighty will not pervert justice.
34.13: Job 34:13 Who gave him charge over the earth, and who laid on him the whole world?
34.14: Job 34:14 If he should set his heart to it and gather to himself his spirit and his breath,
34.15: Job 34:15 all flesh would perish together, and man would return to dust.
34.16: Job 34:16 "If you have understanding, hear this; listen to what I say.
34.17: Job 34:17 Shall one who hates justice govern? Will you condemn him who is righteous and mighty,
34.18: Job 34:18 who says to a king, 'Worthless one,' and to nobles, 'Wicked man,'
34.19:
Job 34:19 who shows no partiality to princes, nor regards the rich more than the poor, for they are all the work
of his hands?
34.20:
Job 34:20 In a moment they die; at midnight the people are shaken and pass away, and the mighty are taken
away by no human hand.
34.21: Job 34:21 "For his eyes are on the ways of a man, and he sees all his steps.
34.22: Job 34:22 There is no gloom or deep darkness where evildoers may hide themselves.
34.23: Job 34:23 For God has no need to consider a man further, that he should go before God in judgment.
34.24: Job 34:24 He shatters the mighty without investigation and sets others in their place.
34.25: Job 34:25 Thus, knowing their works, he overturns them in the night, and they are crushed.
34.26: Job 34:26 He strikes them for their wickedness in a place for all to see,
34.27: Job 34:27 because they turned aside from following him and had no regard for any of his ways,
34.28: Job 34:28 so that they caused the cry of the poor to come to him, and he heard the cry of the afflicted
34.29:
Job 34:29 When he is quiet, who can condemn? When he hides his face, who can behold him, whether it be a
nation or a man?-
34.30: Job 34:30 that a godless man should not reign, that he should not ensnare the people.
34.31: Job 34:31 "For has anyone said to God, 'I have borne punishment; I will not offend any more;
34.32: Job 34:32 teach me what I do not see; if I have done iniquity, I will do it no more'?
34.33:
Job 34:33 Will he then make repayment to suit you, because you reject it? For you must choose, and not I;
therefore declare what you know.
34.34: Job 34:34 Men of understanding will say to me, and the wise man who hears me will say:
34.35: Job 34:35 'Job speaks without knowledge; his words are without insight.'
34.36: Job 34:36 Would that Job were tried to the end, because he answers like wicked men.
34.37: Job 34:37 For he adds rebellion to his sin; he claps his hands among us and multiplies his words against God."

35.1: Job 35:1 And Elihu answered and said:
35.2: Job 35:2 "Do you think this to be just? Do you say, 'It is my right before God,'
35.3: Job 35:3 that you ask, 'What advantage have I? How am I better off than if I had sinned?'
35.4: Job 35:4 I will answer you and your friends with you.
35.5: Job 35:5 Look at the heavens, and see; and behold the clouds, which are higher than you.
35.6:
Job 35:6 If you have sinned, what do you accomplish against him? And if your transgressions are multiplied,
what do you do to him?
35.7: Job 35:7 If you are righteous, what do you give to him? Or what does he receive from your hand?
35.8: Job 35:8 Your wickedness concerns a man like yourself, and your righteousness a son of man.
35.9:
Job 35:9 "Because of the multitude of oppressions people cry out; they call for help because of the arm of the
mighty.
35.10: Job 35:10 But none says, 'Where is God my Maker, who gives songs in the night,
35.11:
Job 35:11 who teaches us more than the beasts of the earth and makes us wiser than the birds of the
heavens?'
35.12: Job 35:12 There they cry out, but he does not answer, because of the pride of evil men.
35.13: Job 35:13 Surely God does not hear an empty cry, nor does the Almighty regard it.
35.14:
Job 35:14 How much less when you say that you do not see him, that the case is before him, and you are
waiting for him!
35.15: Job 35:15 And now, because his anger does not punish, and he does not take much note of transgression,
35.16: Job 35:16 Job opens his mouth in empty talk; he multiplies words without knowledge."

36.1: Job 36:1 And Elihu continued, and said:
36.2: Job 36:2 "Bear with me a little, and I will show you, for I have yet something to say on God's behalf.
36.3: Job 36:3 I will get my knowledge from afar and ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
36.4: Job 36:4 For truly my words are not false; one who is perfect in knowledge is with you.
36.5: Job 36:5 "Behold, God is mighty, and does not despise any; he is mighty in strength of understanding.
36.6: Job 36:6 He does not keep the wicked alive, but gives the afflicted their right.
36.7:
Job 36:7 He does not withdraw his eyes from the righteous, but with kings on the throne he sets them forever,
and they are exalted.
36.8: Job 36:8 And if they are bound in chains and caught in the cords of affliction,
36.9: Job 36:9 then he declares to them their work and their transgressions, that they are behaving arrogantly.
36.10: Job 36:10 He opens their ears to instruction and commands that they return from iniquity.
36.11: Job 36:11 If they listen and serve him, they complete their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasantness.
36.12: Job 36:12 But if they do not listen, they perish by the sword and die without knowledge.
36.13: Job 36:13 "The godless in heart cherish anger; they do not cry for help when he binds them.
36.14: Job 36:14 They die in youth, and their life ends among the cult prostitutes.
36.15: Job 36:15 He delivers the afflicted by their affliction and opens their ear by adversity.
36.16:
Job 36:16 He also allured you out of distress into a broad place where there was no cramping, and what was
set on your table was full of fatness.
36.17: Job 36:17 "But you are full of the judgment on the wicked; judgment and justice seize you.
36.18: Job 36:18 Beware lest wrath entice you into scoffing, and let not the greatness of the ransom turn you aside.
36.19: Job 36:19 Will your cry for help avail to keep you from distress, or all the force of your strength?
36.20: Job 36:20 Do not long for the night, when peoples vanish in their place.
36.21: Job 36:21 Take care; do not turn to iniquity, for this you have chosen rather than affliction.
36.22: Job 36:22 Behold, God is exalted in his power; who is a teacher like him?
36.23: Job 36:23 Who has prescribed for him his way, or who can say, 'You have done wrong'?
36.24: Job 36:24 "Remember to extol his work, of which men have sung.
36.25: Job 36:25 All mankind has looked on it; man beholds it from afar.
36.26: Job 36:26 Behold, God is great, and we know him not; the number of his years is unsearchable.
36.27: Job 36:27 For he draws up the drops of water; they distill his mist in rain,
36.28: Job 36:28 which the skies pour down and drop on mankind abundantly.
36.29: Job 36:29 Can anyone understand the spreading of the clouds, the thunderings of his pavilion?
36.30: Job 36:30 Behold, he scatters his lightning about him and covers the roots of the sea.
36.31: Job 36:31 For by these he judges peoples; he gives food in abundance.
36.32: Job 36:32 He covers his hands with the lightning and commands it to strike the mark.
36.33: Job 36:33 Its crashing declares his presence; the cattle also declare that he rises.

37.1: Job 37:1 "At this also my heart trembles and leaps out of its place.
37.2: Job 37:2 Keep listening to the thunder of his voice and the rumbling that comes from his mouth.
37.3: Job 37:3 Under the whole heaven he lets it go, and his lightning to the corners of the earth.
37.4:
Job 37:4 After it his voice roars; he thunders with his majestic voice, and he does not restrain the lightnings
when his voice is heard.
37.5: Job 37:5 God thunders wondrously with his voice; he does great things that we cannot comprehend.
37.6: Job 37:6 For to the snow he says, 'Fall on the earth,' likewise to the downpour, his mighty downpour.
37.7: Job 37:7 He seals up the hand of every man, that all men whom he made may know it.
37.8: Job 37:8 Then the beasts go into their lairs, and remain in their dens.
37.9: Job 37:9 From its chamber comes the whirlwind, and cold from the scattering winds.
37.10: Job 37:10 By the breath of God ice is given, and the broad waters are frozen fast.
37.11: Job 37:11 He loads the thick cloud with moisture; the clouds scatter his lightning.
37.12:
Job 37:12 They turn around and around by his guidance, to accomplish all that he commands them on the face
of the habitable world.
37.13: Job 37:13 Whether for correction or for his land or for love, he causes it to happen.
37.14: Job 37:14 "Hear this, O Job; stop and consider the wondrous works of God.
37.15: Job 37:15 Do you know how God lays his command upon them and causes the lightning of his cloud to shine?
37.16: Job 37:16 Do you know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him who is perfect in knowledge,
37.17: Job 37:17 you whose garments are hot when the earth is still because of the south wind?
37.18: Job 37:18 Can you, like him, spread out the skies, hard as a cast metal mirror?
37.19: Job 37:19 Teach us what we shall say to him; we cannot draw up our case because of darkness.
37.20: Job 37:20 Shall it be told him that I would speak? Did a man ever wish that he would be swallowed up?
37.21:
Job 37:21 "And now no one looks on the light when it is bright in the skies, when the wind has passed and
cleared them.
37.22: Job 37:22 Out of the north comes golden splendor; God is clothed with awesome majesty.
37.23:
Job 37:23 The Almighty- we cannot find him; he is great in power; justice and abundant righteousness he will
not violate.
37.24: Job 37:24 Therefore men fear him; he does not regard any who are wise in their own conceit."

38.1: Job 38:1 Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind and said:
38.2: Job 38:2 "Who is this that darkens counsel by words without knowledge?
38.3: Job 38:3 Dress for action like a man; I will question you, and you make it known to me.
38.4: Job 38:4 "Where were you when I laid the foundation of the earth? Tell me, if you have understanding.
38.5: Job 38:5 Who determined its measurements- surely you know! Or who stretched the line upon it?
38.6: Job 38:6 On what were its bases sunk, or who laid its cornerstone,
38.7: Job 38:7 when the morning stars sang together and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
38.8: Job 38:8 "Or who shut in the sea with doors when it burst out from the womb,
38.9: Job 38:9 when I made clouds its garment and thick darkness its swaddling band,
38.10: Job 38:10 and prescribed limits for it and set bars and doors,
38.11: Job 38:11 and said, 'Thus far shall you come, and no farther, and here shall your proud waves be stayed'?
38.12: Job 38:12 "Have you commanded the morning since your days began, and caused the dawn to know its place,
38.13: Job 38:13 that it might take hold of the skirts of the earth, and the wicked be shaken out of it?
38.14: Job 38:14 It is changed like clay under the seal, and its features stand out like a garment.
38.15: Job 38:15 From the wicked their light is withheld, and their uplifted arm is broken.
38.16: Job 38:16 "Have you entered into the springs of the sea, or walked in the recesses of the deep?
38.17: Job 38:17 Have the gates of death been revealed to you, or have you seen the gates of deep darkness?
38.18: Job 38:18 Have you comprehended the expanse of the earth? Declare, if you know all this.
38.19: Job 38:19 "Where is the way to the dwelling of light, and where is the place of darkness,
38.20: Job 38:20 that you may take it to its territory and that you may discern the paths to its home?
38.21: Job 38:21 You know, for you were born then, and the number of your days is great!
38.22: Job 38:22 "Have you entered the storehouses of the snow, or have you seen the storehouses of the hail,
38.23: Job 38:23 which I have reserved for the time of trouble, for the day of battle and war?
38.24:
Job 38:24 What is the way to the place where the light is distributed, or where the east wind is scattered upon
the earth?
38.25: Job 38:25 "Who has cleft a channel for the torrents of rain and a way for the thunderbolt,
38.26: Job 38:26 to bring rain on a land where no man is, on the desert in which there is no man,
38.27: Job 38:27 to satisfy the waste and desolate land, and to make the ground sprout with grass?
38.28: Job 38:28 "Has the rain a father, or who has begotten the drops of dew?
38.29: Job 38:29 From whose womb did the ice come forth, and who has given birth to the frost of heaven?
38.30: Job 38:30 The waters become hard like stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.
38.31: Job 38:31 "Can you bind the chains of the Pleiades or loose the cords of Orion?
38.32: Job 38:32 Can you lead forth the Mazzaroth1 in their season, or can you guide the Bear with its children?
38.33: Job 38:33 Do you know the ordinances of the heavens? Can you establish their rule on the earth?
38.34: Job 38:34 "Can you lift up your voice to the clouds, that a flood of waters may cover you?
38.35: Job 38:35 Can you send forth lightnings, that they may go and say to you, 'Here we are'?
38.36: Job 38:36 Who has put wisdom in the inward parts or given understanding to the mind?
38.37: Job 38:37 Who can number the clouds by wisdom? Or who can tilt the waterskins of the heavens,
38.38: Job 38:38 when the dust runs into a mass and the clods stick fast together?
38.39: Job 38:39 "Can you hunt the prey for the lion, or satisfy the appetite of the young lions,
38.40: Job 38:40 when they crouch in their dens or lie in wait in their thicket?
38.41:
Job 38:41 Who provides for the raven its prey, when its young ones cry to God for help, and wander about for
lack of food?

39.1: Job 39:1 "Do you know when the mountain goats give birth? Do you observe the calving of the does?
39.2: Job 39:2 Can you number the months that they fulfill, and do you know the time when they give birth,
39.3: Job 39:3 when they crouch, bring forth their offspring, and are delivered of their young?
39.4: Job 39:4 Their young ones become strong; they grow up in the open; they go out and do not return to them.
39.5: Job 39:5 "Who has let the wild donkey go free? Who has loosed the bonds of the swift donkey,
39.6: Job 39:6 to whom I have given the arid plain for his home and the salt land for his dwelling place?
39.7: Job 39:7 He scorns the tumult of the city; he hears not the shouts of the driver.
39.8: Job 39:8 He ranges the mountains as his pasture, and he searches after every green thing.
39.9: Job 39:9 "Is the wild ox willing to serve you? Will he spend the night at your manger?
39.10: Job 39:10 Can you bind him in the furrow with ropes, or will he harrow the valleys after you?
39.11: Job 39:11 Will you depend on him because his strength is great, and will you leave to him your labor?
39.12: Job 39:12 Do you have faith in him that he will return your grain and gather it to your threshing floor?
39.13: Job 39:13 "The wings of the ostrich wave proudly, but are they the pinions and plumage of love?
39.14: Job 39:14 For she leaves her eggs to the earth and lets them be warmed on the ground,
39.15: Job 39:15 forgetting that a foot may crush them and that the wild beast may trample them.
39.16:
Job 39:16 She deals cruelly with her young, as if they were not hers; though her labor be in vain, yet she has no
fear,
39.17: Job 39:17 because God has made her forget wisdom and given her no share in understanding.
39.18: Job 39:18 When she rouses herself to flee, she laughs at the horse and his rider.
39.19: Job 39:19 "Do you give the horse his might? Do you clothe his neck with a mane?
39.20: Job 39:20 Do you make him leap like the locust? His majestic snorting is terrifying.
39.21: Job 39:21 He paws in the valley and exults in his strength; he goes out to meet the weapons.
39.22: Job 39:22 He laughs at fear and is not dismayed; he does not turn back from the sword.
39.23: Job 39:23 Upon him rattle the quiver, the flashing spear and the javelin.
39.24: Job 39:24 With fierceness and rage he swallows the ground; he cannot stand still at the sound of the trumpet.
39.25:
Job 39:25 When the trumpet sounds, he says 'Aha!' He smells the battle from afar, the thunder of the captains,
and the shouting.
39.26: Job 39:26 "Is it by your understanding that the hawk soars and spreads his wings toward the south?
39.27: Job 39:27 Is it at your command that the eagle mounts up and makes his nest on high?
39.28: Job 39:28 On the rock he dwells and makes his home, on the rocky crag and stronghold.
39.29: Job 39:29 From there he spies out the prey; his eyes behold it afar off.
39.30: Job 39:30 His young ones suck up blood, and where the slain are, there is he."

40.1: Job 40:1 And the LORD said to Job:
40.2: Job 40:2 "Shall a faultfinder contend with the Almighty? He who argues with God, let him answer it."
40.3: Job 40:3 Then Job answered the LORD and said:
40.4: Job 40:4 "Behold, I am of small account; what shall I answer you? I lay my hand on my mouth.
40.5: Job 40:5 I have spoken once, and I will not answer; twice, but I will proceed no further."
40.6: Job 40:6 Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind and said:
40.7: Job 40:7 "Dress for action like a man; I will question you, and you make it known to me.
40.8: Job 40:8 Will you even put me in the wrong? Will you condemn me that you may be in the right?
40.9: Job 40:9 Have you an arm like God, and can you thunder with a voice like his?
40.10: Job 40:10 "Adorn yourself with majesty and dignity; clothe yourself with glory and splendor.
40.11: Job 40:11 Pour out the overflowings of your anger, and look on everyone who is proud and abase him.
40.12: Job 40:12 Look on everyone who is proud and bring him low and tread down the wicked where they stand.
40.13: Job 40:13 Hide them all in the dust together; bind their faces in the world below.
40.14: Job 40:14 Then will I also acknowledge to you that your own right hand can save you.
40.15: Job 40:15 "Behold, Behemoth, which I made as I made you; he eats grass like an ox.
40.16: Job 40:16 Behold, his strength in his loins, and his power in the muscles of his belly.
40.17: Job 40:17 He makes his tail stiff like a cedar; the sinews of his thighs are knit together.
40.18: Job 40:18 His bones are tubes of bronze, his limbs like bars of iron.
40.19: Job 40:19 "He is the first of the works of God; let him who made him bring near his sword!
40.20: Job 40:20 For the mountains yield food for him where all the wild beasts play.
40.21: Job 40:21 Under the lotus plants he lies, in the shelter of the reeds and in the marsh.
40.22: Job 40:22 For his shade the lotus trees cover him; the willows of the brook surround him.
40.23:
Job 40:23 Behold, if the river is turbulent he is not frightened; he is confident though Jordan rushes against his
mouth.
40.24: Job 40:24 Can one take him by his eyes, or pierce his nose with a snare?

41.1: Job 41:1 "Can you draw out Leviathan with a fishhook or press down his tongue with a cord?
41.2: Job 41:2 Can you put a rope in his nose or pierce his jaw with a hook?
41.3: Job 41:3 Will he make many pleas to you? Will he speak to you soft words?
41.4: Job 41:4 Will he make a covenant with you to take him for your servant forever?
41.5: Job 41:5 Will you play with him as with a bird, or will you put him on a leash for your girls?
41.6: Job 41:6 Will traders bargain over him? Will they divide him up among the merchants?
41.7: Job 41:7 Can you fill his skin with harpoons or his head with fishing spears?
41.8: Job 41:8 Lay your hands on him; remember the battle- you will not do it again!
41.9: Job 41:9 Behold, the hope of a man is false; he is laid low even at the sight of him.
41.10: Job 41:10 No one is so fierce that he dares to stir him up. Who then is he who can stand before me?
41.11: Job 41:11 Who has first given to me, that I should repay him? Whatever is under the whole heaven is mine.
41.12: Job 41:12 "I will not keep silence concerning his limbs, or his mighty strength, or his goodly frame.
41.13: Job 41:13 Who can strip off his outer garment? Who would come near him with a bridle?
41.14: Job 41:14 Who can open the doors of his face? Around his teeth is terror.
41.15: Job 41:15 His back is made of rows of shields, shut up closely as with a seal.
41.16: Job 41:16 One is so near to another that no air can come between them.
41.17: Job 41:17 They are joined one to another; they clasp each other and cannot be separated.
41.18: Job 41:18 His sneezings flash forth light, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the dawn.
41.19: Job 41:19 Out of his mouth go flaming torches; sparks of fire leap forth.
41.20: Job 41:20 Out of his nostrils comes forth smoke, as from a boiling pot and burning rushes.
41.21: Job 41:21 His breath kindles coals, and a flame comes forth from his mouth.
41.22: Job 41:22 In his neck abides strength, and terror dances before him.
41.23: Job 41:23 The folds of his flesh stick together, firmly cast on him and immovable.
41.24: Job 41:24 His heart is hard as a stone, hard as the lower millstone.
41.25: Job 41:25 When he raises himself up the mighty are afraid; at the crashing they are beside themselves.
41.26: Job 41:26 Though the sword reaches him, it does not avail, nor the spear, the dart, or the javelin.
41.27: Job 41:27 He counts iron as straw, and bronze as rotten wood.
41.28: Job 41:28 The arrow cannot make him flee; for him sling stones are turned to stubble.
41.29: Job 41:29 Clubs are counted as stubble; he laughs at the rattle of javelins.
41.30: Job 41:30 His underparts are like sharp potsherds; he spreads himself like a threshing sledge on the mire.
41.31: Job 41:31 He makes the deep boil like a pot; he makes the sea like a pot of ointment.
41.32: Job 41:32 Behind him he leaves a shining wake; one would think the deep to be white-haired.
41.33: Job 41:33 On earth there is not his like, a creature without fear.
41.34: Job 41:34 He sees everything that is high; he is king over all the sons of pride."

42.1: Job 42:1 Then Job answered the LORD and said:
42.2: Job 42:2 "I know that you can do all things, and that no purpose of yours can be thwarted.
42.3:
Job 42:3 'Who is this that hides counsel without knowledge?' Therefore I have uttered what I did not understand,
things too wonderful for me, which I did not know.
42.4: Job 42:4 'Hear, and I will speak; I will question you, and you make it known to me.'
42.5: Job 42:5 I had heard of you by the hearing of the ear, but now my eye sees you;
42.6: Job 42:6 therefore I despise myself, and repent in dust and ashes."
42.7:
Job 42:7 After the LORD had spoken these words to Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite: "My anger
burns against you and against your two friends, for you have not spoken of me what is right, as my servant Job
has.
42.8:
Job 42:8 Now therefore take seven bulls and seven rams and go to my servant Job and offer up a burnt offering
for yourselves. And my servant Job shall pray for you, for I will accept his prayer not to deal with you according
to your folly. For you have not spoken of me what is right, as my servant Job has."
42.9:
Job 42:9 So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went and did what the
LORD had told them, and the LORD accepted Job's prayer.
42.10:
Job 42:10 And the LORD restored the fortunes of Job, when he had prayed for his friends. And the LORD gave
